skill.name: @delon/form Dynamic Schema Forms
skill.description: Create dynamic schema-based forms using @delon/form (SF component). Use this skill when building complex forms with validation, conditional rendering, async data loading, custom widgets, and multi-step workflows. Ensures forms follow JSON Schema standards, integrate with Angular reactive forms, support internationalization, and maintain consistent validation patterns across the application.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md with code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reads. This is a safe prompt-based guidance resource.

content.value_statement: Creating complex forms requires extensive boilerplate code. @delon/form enables declarative form generation using JSON Schema, reducing development time and ensuring consistent validation across your Angular application.
actual_capabilities: Generate forms from JSON Schema definitions
Implement 15+ form widget types (select, autocomplete, date, upload)
Create conditional field visibility based on form state
Add custom validators for complex business rules
Build multi-step wizard forms with step navigation
Configure responsive grid layouts for all screen sizes
limitations: Does not generate complete Angular application code
Limited to client-side form validation patterns

output_examples.input: Create a user registration form with @delon/form including name, email, password, confirm password, and role selection
output: Form Schema: Properties for name (required, maxLength 100), email (format email), password (custom validator), confirm password (match validator), role (enum dropdown)
UI Schema: Grid layout with 2 columns, placeholder text, select widget for role
Validators: Password minimum 8 chars with uppercase requirement, confirm password must match
Actions: Submit and reset buttons with loading state handling

best_practices: Define required fields in the schema to ensure proper validation
Use appropriate widget types matching your data type (string, number, boolean)
Implement async data loading for dynamic dropdowns to reduce initial payload
anti_patterns: Using hardcoded values instead of enum definitions for selectable options
Skipping form error handling, which leaves users without feedback
Defining complex validators inline rather than extracting to reusable functions

faq.question: Which Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: @delon/form requires Angular 17 or later with standalone component support enabled

faq.question: What is the maximum number of form fields?
faq.answer: No strict limit exists. Performance depends on browser capabilities and validation complexity

faq.question: Can I integrate with reactive forms?
faq.answer: Yes, SFComponent provides events for integration with Angular reactive forms and state management

faq.question: Is user input data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides documentation. Form data handling depends on your application implementation

faq.question: How do I debug form validation issues?
faq.answer: Use the formError event handler to capture and log validation errors for troubleshooting

faq.question: How does this compare to Angular reactive forms?
faq.answer: @delon/form adds declarative schema-based generation while still supporting custom validators and reactive patterns
